Notes.Text:
This update for perl-DBI fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:

- CVE-2020-14392: Memory corruption in XS functions when Perl stack is reallocated (bsc#1176412).
- CVE-2020-14393: Fixed a buffer overflow on an overlong DBD class name (bsc#1176409).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution for Non-Commercial usage (CC-BY-NC-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP2

Vulnerabilities.Description: An untrusted pointer dereference flaw was found in Perl-DBI < 1.643. A local attacker who is able to manipulate calls to dbd_db_login6_sv() could cause memory corruption, affecting the service's availability.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP2:perl-DBI-1.642-3.3.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: A buffer overflow was found in perl-DBI < 1.643 in DBI.xs. A local attacker who is able to supply a string longer than 300 characters could cause an out-of-bounds write, affecting the availability of the service or integrity of data.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP2:perl-DBI-1.642-3.3.1
